pullRequest.body:
From GibbsMeasure

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [e90270508c](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17835/commits/e90270508c373f063fa14e45adec8fee6d5df3c9)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Measurable.ennreal_sigmaFinite_induction`
`+ coe_le_coe`
`+ coe_lt_coe`
`+ eapprox_mono`
`+ iSup_coe_eapprox`
`+ mk_le_mk`
`+ mk_lt_mk`
`+ piecewise_mono`
`++++ ⟨_,`
`- coe_le`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

A function that can be approached by finite measure simple functions is [MeasureTheory.FinStronglyMeasurable](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/MeasureTheory/Function/StronglyMeasurable/Basic.html#MeasureTheory.FinStronglyMeasurable)

The result [MeasureTheory.finStronglyMeasurable_iff_measurable](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/MeasureTheory/Function/StronglyMeasurable/Basic.html#MeasureTheory.finStronglyMeasurable_iff_measurable) states that it is equivalent to measurability in a space with second countable topology and a sigma-finite measure.

Could those results be used in your applications?

Yes and no:
* I really need the explicit sequence of finite mass functions as I use it to define the Lesbegue conditional [here](https://github.com/james18lpc/GibbsMeasure/blob/main/GibbsMeasure/Prereqs/LebesgueCondExp.lean#L12-L23).
* I am happy to define it for `FinStronglyMeasurable` functions instead, if you ask.
* I don't need the induction principle `Measurable.ennreal_sigmaFinite_induction`. I will remove it if you ask.

What makes the sequence you get from FinStronglyMeasurable unfit for your purpose? Does it lack some property?([MeasureTheory.FinStronglyMeasurable.approx](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/MeasureTheory/Function/StronglyMeasurable/Basic.html#MeasureTheory.FinStronglyMeasurable.approx))
I just didn't know it existed! That solves my first two bullet points. What about the third?

FinStronglyMeasurable is not used much, and well hidden inside the StronglyMeasurable file, so it's no surprise you did not know about it!

For the third point, I'd say that the induction principle could be useful and I would be happy to merge it.

I thought I could generalise the induction principle to any `FinStronglyMeasurable` function but actually I'm not sure. Here is the statement I attempted (to be added on L.1881 of `MeasureTheory.Function.StronglyMeasurable.Basic`):
````
variable {mα : MeasurableSpace α} {μ : Measure α}

/-- To prove something for an arbitrary `μ`-finite strongly measurable function into `ℝ≥0∞`, it
suffices to show that the property holds for (multiples of) characteristic functions with finite
`μ`-mass and is closed under addition and supremum of increasing sequences of functions.

It is possible to make the hypotheses in the induction steps a bit stronger, and such conditions
can be added once we need them (for example in `h_add` it is only necessary to consider the sum of
a simple function with a multiple of a characteristic function and that the intersection
of their images is a subset of `{0}`. -/
@[elab_as_elim]
lemma FinStronglyMeasurable.ennreal_induction {P : (α → ℝ≥0∞) → Prop}
    (h_ind : ∀ (c : ℝ≥0∞) ⦃s⦄, MeasurableSet s → μ s < ∞ → P (Set.indicator s fun _ => c))
    (h_add :
      ∀ ⦃f g : α → ℝ≥0∞⦄,
        Disjoint (support f) (support g) → Measurable f → Measurable g → P f → P g → P (f + g))
    (h_iSup :
      ∀ ⦃f : ℕ → α → ℝ≥0∞⦄, (∀ n, Measurable (f n)) → Monotone f → (∀ n, P (f n)) →
        P fun x => ⨆ n, f n x)
    ⦃f : α → ℝ≥0∞⦄ (hf : FinStronglyMeasurable f μ) : P f := by
  sorry
```

:v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge

Build failed:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11719283490/job/32642206592)

It looks good, let's merge this.
bors d+

It looks good, let's merge this.
bors d+

```suggestion
    (h_ind : ∀ (c : ℝ≥0∞) ⦃s⦄, MeasurableSet s → μ s < ∞ → P (Set.indicator s fun _ ↦ c))
```

pullRequest.title: feat: induction principle for `ENNReal`-valued measurable functions from a sigma-finite space

I just didn't know it existed! That solves my first two bullet points. What about the third?

FinStronglyMeasurable is not used much, and well hidden inside the StronglyMeasurable file, so it's no surprise you did not know about it!

For the third point, I'd say that the induction principle could be useful and I would be happy to merge it.

I thought I could generalise the induction principle to any `FinStronglyMeasurable` function but actually I'm not sure. Here is the statement I attempted (to be added on L.1881 of `MeasureTheory.Function.StronglyMeasurable.Basic`):
````
variable {mα : MeasurableSpace α} {μ : Measure α}

/-- To prove something for an arbitrary `μ`-finite strongly measurable function into `ℝ≥0∞`, it
suffices to show that the property holds for (multiples of) characteristic functions with finite

It is possible to make the hypotheses in the induction steps a bit stronger, and such conditions
can be added once we need them (for example in `h_add` it is only necessary to consider the sum of
a simple function with a multiple of a characteristic function and that the intersection
of their images is a subset of `{0}`. -/
@[elab_as_elim]
lemma FinStronglyMeasurable.ennreal_induction {P : (α → ℝ≥0∞) → Prop}
    (h_ind : ∀ (c : ℝ≥0∞) ⦃s⦄, MeasurableSet s → μ s < ∞ → P (Set.indicator s fun _ => c))
    (h_add :
      ∀ ⦃f g : α → ℝ≥0∞⦄,
        Disjoint (support f) (support g) → Measurable f → Measurable g → P f → P g → P (f + g))
    (h_iSup :
      ∀ ⦃f : ℕ → α → ℝ≥0∞⦄, (∀ n, Measurable (f n)) → Monotone f → (∀ n, P (f n)) →
        P fun x => ⨆ n, f n x)
    ⦃f : α → ℝ≥0∞⦄ (hf : FinStronglyMeasurable f μ) : P f := by
  sorry
```

It looks good, let's merge this.
bors d+

:v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
